snippet: Companies allocating fewer than 40 percent of seats on supervisory boards to women could face sanctions, according to a proposal by the European Union justice commissioner.
abstract: European Union justice commissioner Viviane Reding proposes that state-owned companies allocate at least 40 percent of seats on supervisory boards to women by 2018 or face sanctions.
lead_paragraph: Companies allocating fewer than 40 percent of seats on supervisory boards to women could face sanctions, according to a proposal by the European Union justice commissioner.

headline.main: European Proposal Presses for Women to Join Boards
